column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=On gay rights
#Text=I interviewed the writer Augusten Burroughs .
#Text=I would like you to answer a question that he posed .

#Text=He said that " God does not care that the person I watch TV with also has hairy arms , that the idea that a God would not like homosexuals is patently absurd , that it does n't even begin to become logical in any way , that the idea that the architect of gravity , the being that created the ability for elemental particles that are absolutely nothing to come together and create living organisms and bricks and buildings and cars and jets , that the architect of absolutely everything would care about the sex of the person that this little human loves seems ridiculous . "

column1: #Text=Why is that not ridiculous ?
#Text=I think He cares about everything .
#Text=I do n't know that everybody would take this as authoritative , but the Bible talks about a sparrow not falling without Him knowing that --
#Text=He 's numbered the hairs on your head , so that He cares about everything , and He 's certainly a God of love -- He loves us very much .
#Text=That 's one of His central attributes , that He 's a God of love , so I think He cares about everything and that there 's nothing that would escape His view .
#Text=We also have absolute free will to do as we see fit ; we 're not robots by any means .
#Text=But I think He cares about everything .
#Text=Why do you think it would bother God that somebody is gay ?
#Text=Well , you 're asking a theological question on something I 'm just really probably not competent to answer .

#Text=It usually gets asked in a context of the institution of marriage , and there , where I think the great need is for our society , is to uphold the institution as it has been , to recognize its great contribution to the raising of the next generation , and to see that more people , more of our next generation , is raised in a setting where you have a mom and a dad bonded together for life .

#Text=The reason there is a State interest is that in all the social data -- we know from all the social data that the best place to raise a child , is between a mom and a dad bonded together for life , that your highest percentage of children in that setting will get a good education , will generally get a good working environment , life — they ’ll perform best .
#Text=Now you can raise a good child in a single-parent family ; you can raise a terrible child in a two-parent , stable setting .
#Text=So things do n't always work that way .
#Text=But we do know from all the data that the best place for most is in that two-parent setting .
#Text=When you redefine marriage -- the countries that have done this , they 've see their marriage rates go down , and the institution be weakened , and fewer children raised in that setting .
#Text=That 's why I think it 's important to really stand for marriage being the union of a man and a woman .
